**Yellow dragon scale mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [5.3 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.4 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.5 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.6 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Yellow dragon scale mail is not randomly generated, though it can be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for or found in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"). Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [red dragon scales](/wiki/Red_dragon_scales "Red dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") yellow dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, yellow dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing yellow dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 9942b65d](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/9942b65df78dd55a7806ec), extrinsic sources of an elemental resistance now has a 99⁄100 chance of protecting your inventory from that type of damage. Per [commit ef1eeed7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ef1eeed7550e38fa1e4ff0ef608f3c8b55eaa950), both the scales and scale mail also provide [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

Yellow dragon scale mail is perhaps the type that is least used by most characters: though acid resistance cannot be obtained intrinsically without polymorph, and [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage can be annoying to deal with (especially in terms of inventory damage), many sources of acid are either [sessile](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile") or slow in movement [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"). The remaining major acidic threats consist of the yellow dragon, whose breath can be blocked with [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), and the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon"), who has several breath weapons and all but warrants reflection when dealing with her. Even for characters that have constant trouble with acid, an [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock") can suffice for those with an open [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") slot.

[Mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") pets are among those that will most appreciate a suit of yellow dragon mail, and characters opting to stick to a polyform with multiple attacks (e.g. [speed ascension](/wiki/Speed_ascension "Speed ascension") play as a [master mind flayer](/wiki/Master_mind_flayer "Master mind flayer")) may also consider yellow dragon scale mail.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Yellow dragon scale mail is somewhat more likely to be considered for some characters since it confers extrinsic acid resistance and stoning resistance: they gain a source of acid damage protection for their inventory, and the stoning resistance allows a character to easily fight threats such as [cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") and [chickatrices](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice"), wield and consume their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), and also trivialize [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") without instantly killing her. [Vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian"), [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") and [foodless](/wiki/Foodless "Foodless") [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") that opt for body armor and cover [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") via other means may consider yellow dragon scale mail, which removes the threat of [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") without breaking the [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").

## History

Yellow dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, yellow dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a yellow dragon. Yellow dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Several variants also give yellow dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of yellow dragon scale armor. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make yellow dragon mail and other colors more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, acid damage is much more of a threat in the mid- and late-game due to the introduction of new [jellies](/wiki/Jellies "Jellies") and the dreaded [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)") and [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth"). For this reason, a character with reflection, magic resistance, and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") through other means may decide to opt for yellow dragon scale mail as a defense against powerful acidic foes.

### GruntHack

[GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack")'s implementation of [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") makes it possible for dragon scale mail and other magical items to have an additional property, unlike implementations of object properties in later variants.

Since it is possible and commonplace to wish for an item that provides both magic resistance and reflection (e.g. usually "blessed greased +3 dragonhide [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") and reflection"), the remaining properties are usually covered via other wishes - for characters that can wear body armor and make the example wish yellow dragon scale mail of decay (which adds [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")) is the most common secondary wish, as it blocks two of the most pressing remaining threats: [drain life](/wiki/Spellbook_of_drain_life "Spellbook of drain life") and [acid blast](/wiki/Spellbook_of_acid_blast "Spellbook of acid blast"), which hostile spellcasters of certain levels can have access to.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), worn yellow dragon scale mail additionally confers [stun resistance](/index.php?title=Stun_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Stun resistance (page does not exist)") and [confusion resistance](/index.php?title=Confusion_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Confusion resistance (page does not exist)").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing") can create dragon scale mail directly.

Yellow dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **acid dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn yellow dragon scale mail additionally confers stoning resistance.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), worn yellow dragon scale mail additionally confers stoning resistance. It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 156](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L156): *initial body armor for Astral playermons is random DSM, with equal probability*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 518](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L518)
